page.title: 11Day In The Life Of J.House
page.content: Junior House is the smaller of the two preparatory schools at St. Edmund's College. Boys living in Junior House are woken at 7.00 am for morning prayers and mass.Afer this they have breakfast in the main dining hall untill 8.15 am. They return to the house where they make their beds and tidy up their dormitories under the supervision of the House Matron.Between 8.30-9.00 am the day boys and girls arrive in coaches from places as far apart as Stevenage,Bishops Stortford and North London.The bell at 9.15 am heralds the start of the teaching day with two classes up to break at 10.35.Morning break is traditionally the Tuck Shop time,again under the supervision of Matron,with two pupils helping her.
